p: Hypertension has been a global health problem owing to its recurrent incidence, incessant, and uncontrolled threat for associated cardiovascular and kidney diseases [ 32]. According to an estimation by the world health organization (WHO), presently, 17.1 million deaths are happening each year worldwide due to different CVDs [ 33]. Owing to lifelong use and undesired effects of current allopathic drugs, research has been inclined towards the discovery of novel, curative, and safe therapeutic agents of natural origin for the management of CVDs [ 34]. Ethnopharmacology has been used as a successful tool to find new strategies and candidates for novel drugs and herbal medicines [ 35]. Since ancient times, medicinal plants have led to the development of highly effective tools for therapeutic purposes. Numerous studies have revealed that several plants have been pharmacologically evaluated based upon their empirical usage for the therapy of hypertension, and many of the currently marketed pharmaceutical drugs are synthesized based upon phytoconstituents isolated from these plants [ 1, 36]. Due to these reasons, in the current study, Asphodelus tenuifolius have been selected based upon the popular usage in diuresis and hypertension, for thorough pharmacological appraisal.
